content: tulip scrunchie pattern designed by island magic handmade island magic handmade materials needed yarn of your choice crochet hook darning needle scissors abbreviations us terms chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet stsc - stacked single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet st - stitch slip_stitch - slip_stitch space - space pattern notes i used yarnart begonia mercerized cotton yarn green and pink colors and kartopu organica cotton yarn white and hook size 3 mm to create the scrunchie in this pattern you can use any yarn and hook size you prefer the waviness of the scrunchie is customizable if you want a wavier scrunchie add as many single_crochet as you can in row 1 if you want a less wavy scrunchie add just enough to cover the ponytail when it s not stretched out in this pattern i used a dark brown ponytail and a light base color you can see the ponytail bleeding through a little bit so i suggest you use a ponytail that matches your base color 2 island magic handmade measurements note these are the measurements of my scrunchie when using hook size 3 mm and weight 2 yarn yours will differ if you use any other hook size and/or yarn copyright this pattern is understanding website https //www islandmagichandmade com & https //www islandmagic store etsy islandmagicshop 3 island magic handmade pattern instructions you need 3 different colors to crochet the scrunchie color a = the base color of the body and the border i m using a white color color b = the color of the flower stems i m using a light green color color c = the color of the tulips i m using a bright pink color row 1 using color a put a slipknot on your hook and crochet a single_crochet around the ponytail continue placing single_crochet around the ponytail from time to time push the stitches closer together to make room for new stitches you should not be able to see the ponytail through your stitches when not stretched out 4 island magic handmade the total amount of stitches you have should be a multiple of 3 for example i added 84 single_crochet around my ponytail the more stitches you can fit around your ponytail the wavier the scrunchie will be when you are done with adding stitches around your ponytail slip_stitch to the first single_crochet of the row 5 island magic handmade row 2 chain 1 crochet 1 single_crochet into each existing at around by the end you should have as many stitches as you did in row 1 slip_stitch to the first st of the row cut your yarn
